intro: Goniothalamus tapis, commonly known as the Tapis mountain vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae, which includes many tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and greenish-white, with a subtle fragrance. The fruit is a fleshy, yellowish berry that contains several seeds.
